lines.text: 数学がアイデンティティだった
最初の5年をガバナンスメカニズムの数理構造に費やしたが、自分が探していたものが不可能だと分かった
[" money and banks or government control of currency]は誰も問題にしないから、暗号通貨なんか世間は興味ない
> Remind people that money and finance still do matter, and do a good job of serving the world's underserved in that niche

> Extend beyond finance, and use our technology to build a more holistic vision of an alternative, more free and open and democratic tech stack, and how that could build toward either a broadly better society, or at least tools to help those who are excluded from mainstream digital infrastructure today.
伝統的な技術スタックと別のスタックを作る
中国が国内で独自の進化を遂げたみたいに
Ethereumの場合、分散に焦点を当てる
> The first answer is important, and I would argue that the crypto space is uniquely positioned to provide value there.

>San Francisco, I get a distinct impression that they think that AI is the only thing that matters, San Francisco is the capital of AI, and therefore San Francisco is the only place that matters. "So, Vitalik, why are you not settled down in the Bay with an O1 visa yet"? Crypto does not need to play this game: it's a big world, and it only takes one visit to Argentina or Turkey or Zambia to remind ourselves that many people still do have important problems that have to do with access to money and finance, and there is still an opportunity to do the complicated work of balancing user experience and decentralization to actually solve those problems in a sustainable way.
